definition: knell
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong
a knell

sentences.english: Knell beetles have also been known to be used as mounts by Underdark races.
sentences.chinese: 已经知道丧钟甲虫会被幽暗地域的种族用作坐骑。

sentences.english: It was tolling for the funeral service.
sentences.chinese: 这是宣布葬礼开始的丧钟。

sentences.english: It sounded the death knell of all her hopes.
sentences.chinese: 那事听起来就像是给她的一切希望敲起了丧钟。

sentences.english: Knell beetles were used as mounts by the warrior legions of the ancient Dhakaan Empire.
sentences.chinese: 丧钟甲虫被古代达卡安帝国的武士军团作为坐骑使用。

sentences.english: Now I hear them --- Ding-dong, bell.
sentences.chinese: 我现在听到了叮咚的丧钟。

sentences.english: And four days afterwards the bells toll for a funeral in the convent of Borglum.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节后第三天晚上，伯尔厄隆修道院敲响了丧钟。

sentences.english: A diplomatic crisis would sound the death knell of any hopes of disarmament.
sentences.chinese: 外交上的危机将为任何裁军希望敲响丧钟。

sentences.english: And the funeral bells surely tolled this week when General Motors filed for bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 本周当通用汽车公司破产时，丧钟必将敲响。

sentences.english: Change is our life-blood, stagnation our death knell.
sentences.chinese: 改变是我们的生命血脉，停滞则如同敲起丧钟。

sentences.english: "This court settlement signals the death knell for mercury fillings, " Brown predicted.
sentences.chinese: 这个庭外和解敲响了汞填充物的丧钟。

sentences.english: And the undertaker starts to ring my funeral bell.
sentences.chinese: 当送葬者开始摇响我葬礼的丧钟。

sentences.english: At that moment all the church bells in Palermo began to ring for Vespers .
sentences.chinese: 那一刻所有教堂的钟声在巴勒莫开始响丧钟。

sentences.english: Who'll toll the bell? "I, " said the bull.
That kind of post is a death knell for a blog.
sentences.chinese: 这样的帖子就像给博客敲丧钟。

definition: to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
alarm bell
bugle horn
overture
first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
sound of gunfire/fig. news of momentous events
to press sb to death/fig. to pressurize sb continually
last day/end/final days/doomsday
Judgment Day (in Christian eschatology)
destruction
end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
sound of a drum/drumbeat
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
rumble
great mansion on the verge of collapse (idiom); hopeless situation
